lg.l: When a ·Dc\tittle\or Robinson Bishop of Bristoll Lord Privy Seal and Plenipotentiary for the treaty of peace at Utrecth in 1712. holy black Sweede, the son of Bob,
With a Saint at his Chin, and a Seal in his Fob,
Shall not see ·he went over to Utrecth before our New Years Day and arrived there after theirs. one new years Day in that Year,
Then let old England make good Cheer.
·he was Dean of Windsor and Bishop of Bristoll when he was sent over to. Windsor and Bristol then shall be
Joyn'd together in the Low ·Utrecth. Countrey.
Then shall the tall black ·Lord Nottingham. Daventry Bird
Speak against Peace right many a Word;
And some shall admire his cunning Witt,
For many good Groats ·said to be bought off by the Dutchesse of Malborough to speak against the peace. his tongue shall slitt:
But in Spite of the ·Duke of Malborough. Harpy, that cralls on all four,
We shall have peace perdie, and War no more.
But England must cry alack and well a day,
Jf the Stick ·Harley Earl of Oxford Baron Mortimer and then Lord Treasurer. be taken from the dead Sea.
But O Englond, if ought J understand,
Beware of ·The Dutchess of Somermett \sic\ heir to Northumberland. Carrots from Northumberland:
Carrotts sown ·Thynne assassinated in Somersett house by Coninsmark by the Dutchess of Somersett's order. Thynne, a deep root may gett,
Jf so be they are in ·\same as note 10\. Somer-sett;
Their ·\same as note 10\. Conings-mark thou, for as J have been told,
They ·the Dutchess of Somersett is said to have poisoned one of her servants who had lain with her that he might not ever discover it. assasin when Young, and poison when Old.
Root out those Carrotts, oh thou, whose Name
is Backwards and forwards alwaies the ·Queen Anna. same,
And keep close unto Thee, alwaies that Name,
Which backward and forward is almost the ·Mris. Masham. same.
And Englond, would thou be happy still,
Bury these Carrotts under ·Mris. Masham's sister to be putt in Somersett's places at Court. a hill.
